intro: Linanthus luteolus, commonly known as the yellow flax or desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Linanthus luteolus produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is adapted to thrive in harsh, arid conditions with minimal water availability.
